The prover program requires the Boost interval arithmetic and math
libraries, and the GNU MPFR library installed (in Ubuntu, the packages
libboost-dev and libmpfr4 can be used to provide these libraries).

alpha_GW: is the Geomans-Williamson max-cut approximation constant.

The makefile produces the program prover_smc, which checks that the
approximation ratio of the dictatorship test gadget for simultaneous max cut, 
given in  "Simultaneous Max-Cut is harder to approximate than Max-Cut"
(https://eccc.weizmann.ac.il/report/2019/148/)
 is at most (alpha_GW- 0.00001). The parameters used can be tweaked by editing
prover_smc.cc.

You can also provide a command line parameter (a number between 0 and 1)
 instead of the hard-wired number (alpha_GW- 0.00001).


Example usage:

```
terminal$ make
c++ -O3 -Wall -c -o alpha.o alpha.cc
c++ -O3 -Wall -c -o bvnl.o bvnl.cc
c++ -O3 -Wall -c -o rectangles.o rectangles.cc
c++ -O3 -Wall -c -o gaussian.o gaussian.cc
c++ -O3 -Wall   -c -o search_smc.o search_smc.cc
c++ -O3 -Wall -o prover_smc prover_smc.cc alpha.o bvnl.o rectangles.o gaussian.o search_smc.o -lmpfr

terminal$ time ./prover_smc
